line.text: From you have I been absent in the spring
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: When proud-pied April (dressed in all his trim)
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Hath put a spirit of youth in every thing
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: That heavy Saturn laughed and leaped with him
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Yet nor the lays of birds nor the sweet smell
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Of different flowers in odour and in hue
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Could make me any summer story tell
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Or from their proud lap pluck them where they grew
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Nor did I wonder at the lily white
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Nor praise the deep vermilion in the rose
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: They were but sweet but figures of delight
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Drawn after you you pattern of all those
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Yet seemed it winter still and you away
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: As with your shadow I with these did play
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
